author: Isabelle Fraser
title: David Beckham hits out at criticism of four-year-old Harper's dummy
text: David Beckham has hit out at criticism of his four-year-old daughter Harper's use of a dummy. He was responding to an article in the Daily Mail which Quote: d parenting experts saying that Harper could be at risk of speech or dental issues later in life as a result of using her dummy. He wrote in an angry Instagram comment: “Why do people feel they have the right to criticise a parent about their own children without having any facts ??" • Where do we stand on dummies for four year-olds? • Parents urged to bin booster seats David Beckham/Instagram It continued: “Everybody who has children knows that when they aren’t feeling well or have a fever you do what comforts them best and most of the time it’s a pacifier so those who criticise think twice about what you say about other people’s children because actually you have no right to criticise me as a parent…” Beckham's Instagram post has been liked 587,000 times, and he has 10.2 million followers. Comments on the post have largely been supportive of Beckham, and created a big debate across social media. NHS guidelines say that dummies should be used on children up to 12 months. • Dummy trees and sleeping outside: parenting customs around the world • David Beckham: 'Brooklyn thinks I'm an embarrassing dad' telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraphnews
